intro: Xylopia nitida var. nervosa, commonly known as the veined xylopia, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Annonaceae family. It is characterized by its smooth, dark brown bark and ovate, glossy leaves with prominent venation. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by round, woody fruits. Native to tropical regions of Central and South America, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural studies.
